thread.title: 'Philip K. Dick's Electric Dreams' to begin filming in Chicago this week
thread.title_full: 'Philip K. Dick's Electric Dreams' to begin filming in Chicago this week - Hartford Courant

title: 'Philip K. Dick's Electric Dreams' to begin filming in Chicago this week
author: Tracy Swartz
text:
The Amazon anthology series "Philip K. Dick's Electric Dreams" is slated to begin filming in the Chicago area Wednesday.
The sci-fi drama, which features 10 stand-alone episodes inspired by Dick's short stories, has been shooting in London . Production moves to Chicago this week and Brookfield's Overholt Fields next week.  Bryan Cranston serves as an executive producer with  Greg Kinnear and Steve Buscemi part of the cast .
Chicago's 4 Star Casting  posted calls on Facebook for SUV/minivan drivers; women who look like  Mireille Enos ("The Catch") and don't mind being nearly nude in an enclosed space with "slimy" makeup on their body; and little league fans 30-75 years old, among other extras roles. Filming is set to wrap up here in mid-July.
MOST READ ENTERTAINMENT NEWS THIS HOUR 
Channel 4 commissioned the series, which is slated to air later this year in the United Kingdom. Amazon has not announced a U.S. stream date.
Meanwhile, Steve McQueen's heist flick "Widows" is scheduled to film May 8-July 20 in Chicago. Liam Neeson , Colin Farrell , Viola Davis , Robert Duvall  and Michelle Rodriguez  have been attached to the project.
"What They Had," Elizabeth Chomko's drama starring Hilary Swank and Michael Shannon, is set to wrap up here in coming days.
And a Fox pilot about an alleged sexual assault at an Illinois university starring Archie Panjabi ("The Good Wife") and Christine Lahti ("Jack and Bobby") completed Chicago filming April 4.
